desc.p: Shows which days in the month are working days and which are non-working days.
Validation Rules
31 type AAA (alpha) characters, one for each day of the month, W = working day H = non-working day X = non-existent day, e.g. February 30th (Internal field, no input.)

Identifies the non-working weekend days for the Country/Region. Note : When a new record is input, field will show SA and SU automatically which can be overwritten. (Multivalue field) (Optional input) This field allows all weekend days to be automatically calculated for the Country/Region and year specified in Field 0. Note: When the user wants to define a single day week end (such as the Friday in the Middle East countries), he will then need to eliminate one multivalue field (Field 13.2).
Validation Rules
2 type SSS (uppercase alpha) characters: MO = Monday TU = Tuesday WE = Wednesday TH = Thursday FR = Friday SA = Saturday SU = Sunday

Identifies the public Holidays for February in the specified Country/ Region and year. This field identifies all public Holidays for February in the Country/ Region and year specified in Field 0. Weekends will not be included here. For example: If the Holidays were on the 1st, 4th, 20th and 26th input would be 01 04 20 26. A maximum of 12 Holidays can be defined for each month in addition to weekends, and they can be input in any order.
Validation Rules
Up to 35 characters made up of 2 numeric character day numbers from 01-31 followed by a space. (Optional input) It must be a valid day for February. Duplicate day numbers are not allowed.
